creator: filiperf@isa.utl.pt
text:
Dear Sirs,

I'm not sure if this is a bug.

Using 3.2.2, jdk1.3.1, w2ksp2, and various browsers (Opera5.11, NS601,
Mozilla0.9, ie55sp1, NS477, NS304), and getting:

http://127.0.0.1:8080/admin/contextAdmin/contextAdmin.jsp?submit=View+All+Contexts&addContextPath=&addContextDocBase=&removeContextName=

returns:

httpd code 500
URL contains encoded special chars

Yours,

Filipe R. Fonseca

creator: maggie@voicenet.com
text:
I'm getting this one too, using Mozilla 0.9.2, Apache and Tomcat 3.2.3 on RedHat 7.1
-- 
-----/___.   _)   Margaret Stephanie Leber    / "The art of progress  /
----/(, /|  /| http://voicenet.com/~maggie   / consists of preserving/
---/   / | / |  _   _   _    `  _AOPA 925383/ order amid change and /
--/ ) /  |/  |_(_(_(_/_(_/__(__(/_  FN20hd / change amid order."   /
-/ (_/   '  K3XS  .-/ .-/    ARRL 39280   /___ --A.N.Whitehead ___/
/____ICQ 7161096_(_/_(_/__AMSAT 32844____/ <maggie@voicenet.com>

This problem is still present in Tomcat 3.2.3.  I think this behavior is
related to a security check that was added.

The admin webapp has changed in Tomcat 3.3 such that the URL shown is not
applicable.  However, the equvalent function of displaying all contexts does
work correctly.
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com

text: Since this is fixed in 3.3 I'll mark it as fixed instead of NEW.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
